sentence.Network_en: All of the poems are written in traditional metres and rhyme schemes.
sentence.Network_cn: 所有的诗都按传统的韵律和韵脚而作。

sentence.Network_en: He picked people on a whim, without rhyme or reason.
sentence.Network_cn: 他选人时总是随心所欲，毫无根据。

sentence.Network_en: She lapsed into a little girl voice to deliver a nursery rhyme.
sentence.Network_cn: 她改用童声唱起童谣来。

lj.lj_ly: without rhyme or reason his mood changed.
lj.lj_ls: 他的心情莫名其妙地变了。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English rime, from Old French, from medieval Latin rithmus, via Latin from Greek rhuthmos (see rhythm). The current spelling was introduced in the early 17th cent. under the influence of rhythm

encyclopedia.content: 基本释义 n. 1. 节奏， 韵律2. 规则变化；规律；节律 行业释义 建筑 名词 n. 1. 节奏 生物 名词 n. 1. 节律 体育 1. 节奏2. 节律3. 匀速叫牌4. 匀速打牌 心理 1. 节律英文诗的押韵 压韵（rhyme） 英文诗一般都押韵。 （一） 全韵与半韵（full rhyme and half rhyme）。 全韵是严格的押韵，其要求是： （1） 韵要押在重读音节上，其元音应相同； （2） 元音前的辅音应不同； （3） 如果元音之后有辅音，应相同。 （4） 重读音节之

entry.def: If one word rhymes with another or if two words rhyme, they have a very similar sound. Words that rhyme with each other are often used in poems.

example.ex: June always rhymes with moon in old love songs.
example.tran: 在老情歌中June总是和moon成韵。

example.ex: ...the sort of people who give their children names that rhyme: Donnie, Ronnie, Connie.
example.tran: 给孩子取Donnie, Ronnie, Connie之类押韵的名字的父母

entry.def: If a poem or song rhymes, the lines end with words that have very similar sounds.

example.ex: In his efforts to make it rhyme he seems to have chosen the first word that comes into his head.
example.tran: 为了押韵，他似乎选择了脑海里出现的第一个词。

entry.tran: 押韵词;同韵词;押韵的诗行
entry.def: A rhyme is a word which rhymes with another word, or a set of lines which rhyme.

example.ex: The one rhyme for passion is fashion...
The lyrics are banal and the rhymes clumsy.
example.tran: 歌词平淡老套，押韵生硬蹩脚。

entry.def: A rhyme is a short poem which has rhyming words at the ends of its lines.

example.ex: He was teaching Helen a little rhyme.
example.tran: 他当时正教海伦一首押韵小诗。

entry.def: Rhyme is the use of rhyming words as a technique in poetry. If something is written in rhyme, it is written as a poem in which the lines rhyme.

example.ex: Porter stayed within the rules of rhyme...

entry.tran: 莫名其妙;无缘无故;毫无道理
entry.def: If something happens or is done without rhyme or reason, there seems to be no logical reason for it to happen or be done.

example.ex: He picked people on a whim, without rhyme or reason.
example.tran: 他选人时总是随心所欲，毫无根据。

means.word_mean: 1. correspondence in the sounds of two or more lines (especially final sounds)
2. be similar in sound, especially with respect to the last syllable;

auth_sentence.content: Sometimes there's no rhyme or reason to it.
auth_sentence.res_content: Sometimes there's no rhyme or reason to it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Sometimes there's no rhyme or reason to it.

auth_sentence.content: Lincoln Rhyme was formerly head of forensics for NYPD.
auth_sentence.res_content: Lincoln Rhyme was formerly head of forensics for NYPD.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Lincoln Rhyme was formerly head of forensics for NYPD.

auth_sentence.content: Nonsensical rhyme riding on swaggering guitar and drums.
auth_sentence.res_content: Nonsensical rhyme riding on swaggering guitar and drums.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Nonsensical rhyme riding on swaggering guitar and drums.

Sentence.sentence: As a poet, Ted Hughes had an acute sensitivity to the way in which constraints on self-expression, like the disciplines of metre and rhyme (韵律), spur creative thought

sentences.en: I cannot find a rhyme to “hiccups”.
sentences.cn: 我不能找到和hiccups同韵的词。

sentences.en: Rhyme and meter are assistants to memory.
sentences.cn: 押韵和格律有助于记忆。

jushi.english: This essay hardly makes any sense,it's neither rhyme nor reason.
jushi.chinese: 这篇文章写得不伦不类，简直不知所云。
